summary:
I have been a full-stack software engineer for nearly 5 years where I have worked with clients, software engineers, and managers to ensure the best solutions are implemented for the problems that are faced. I have a passion for making a difference using coding as my tool. With strong analytical skills, problem-solving, and a good eye for detail, I have flourished in my current position. As a Software Engineer, I have participated in the full software and operational life cycle, from analysis, design, and implementation, to DevOps and maintenance, allowing me to grow and make better decisions for the team. When working on projects and tasks, I ensure that the solution not only takes the system into account but also the different users and their experiences.

In terms of the tech stack, I'm open to learning and working with different languages, some that come to mind are Java, Python, Ruby, SQL Server and React. I am excited to learn more alongside a strong team, where I can enjoy learning from and mentoring others in our shared journey of software, team and personal growth. 

I would like to be part of a team that enjoys their work as much as they enjoy each other. A team that works together to make a difference using coding as their tool.

I highly value a work-life balance where I give my 100% while at work but also get a chance to have a personal life. I would also like to find a company that aligns with my values regarding loyalty, trust, honourability, and the general value of each other.

I would prefer working in a hybrid environment with flexible working hours.

profile_positions.description:
Moving into a more senior role in the team has allowed me to take on an increasing number of responsibilities and drive processes within the team.

Working more with AWS from setting up new instances for testing, staging and production to implementing CIS controls across multiple AWS accounts. Working with services like EC2, WAF, EFS, Systems Manager, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Security Hub, Load Balancers, ElastiCache (Redis), IAM, Security Hub, Inspector, AWS Config, Auto Scaling, Code Deploy, etc.)

Technical design and analysis are an important part in the team as we needed to estimate, as accurately as possible, how long client work would take. Throughout the estimation process, I constantly find myself identifying risks in the solution design for the team and I make sure we have a plan to mitigate them. I strive to ensure we give clients the best product possible making sure the design solution is not only well structured from a systems perspective but also ensuring the several types of end-users have a good user experience. I have become the main final Quality Assurance (QA) point within the team due to my strong eye for detail and always pushing myself and my team to deliver high-quality work to our clients.

I have a passion for writing SQL and was called the SQL ninja in the team. I often worked closely with the CTO on our reporting solutions and SQL queries we needed for custom functionality as he is a master in SQL himself.

I strive to continuously make improvements to our team and company. One way is implementing processes. I have actively pushed and helped the team to implement processes that will make our day-to-day jobs easier while making us more efficient and effective as a team and a company.

Soft Skills: Dedication, perseverance, communication, teamwork, problem-solving, easily teachable, approachable, and identifying risks and mitigating them.
profile_positions.title: Mid-level Full Stack Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I have been part of a team that creates digital learning solutions which combine creative design, educational content, and intuitive learning technologies for a sophisticated learner experience.

Using the Moodle platform, (in a LAMP stack) I wrote custom functionality for our clients to allow students and administrators to learn, teach and manage the various aspects required in training courses and university-level degrees.

From writing business and technical requirements to architecting and implementing the different components, I have had many opportunities to learn and be challenged during my time at Hubble Studios. I have built custom functionality, as well as plugins, and done third-party integrations for our clients.

I have had the opportunity to lead a technical project as a project manager, where I learned how to communicate and manage expectations with our clients while also being the developer on the project.

Mentoring and challenging each other was a big part of the team. I had the opportunity to mentor and manage three interns, where I had to ensure they not only had a wonderful experience but also teach them the different aspects of working as a developer.

Using AWS, I started set up new environments for clients which touched on different AWS services such as EC2, EFS, RDS, S3, Load Balancers, and ElastiCache (Redis). I would also patch servers and help with architectural changes we were implementing to our AWS set-up.
profile_positions.title: Junior Full Stack Developer

profile_positions.description:
After completing a second-year information systems module, I became a student assistant therein. I thoroughly enjoyed helping students with this module. A year later I not only continued being a student assistant for information systems but I also decided to become a student assistant for the 3rd Year Project module where I was able to assist groups with their project which they had a year to complete.

Working with databases is one of the things I enjoy so, on the side, I assisted 3rd-year students with Database Systems.

During my time as a student assistant, I had to: prepare for the sessions with students, work well together with the lecturer, be knowledgeable in the subject, and be accessible and available if they had questions outside the session time. I have a concern for students learning, and, was driven to ensure that they understand the work and do well in the module.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant and Tutor for Information Systems and 3rd Year Project

profile_positions.description:
I was a waitress at Ocean Basket for two months. Having never waitressed
before, I was out of my comfort zone – this provided a wonderful
opportunity to grow. I learnt to: multi-task when I had many tables, be 
customer-centered in all I do, master the art of attentive listening, and,
convert requests into win-win outcomes. I had to: prioritise, deal with high
pressure situations, manage my time, give attention to detail, and, deal with
work politics.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

profile_positions.description:
I started as a student assistant, in my second year of study, aiding students
with first year programming (WRA101 – Programming Fundamentals) and
a computer fundamentals module where MATLAB was also covered
(WRSC101 - Computing Fundamentals for Scientists).
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant for WRA101 (Programming)

profile_positions.description:
Sunny Herbs is the largest herb farm in South Africa, and used to export up
to 90% of its herbs to Switzerland. I worked there making boxes and
packing herbs. This is a very labour intensive job, and I had to work quickly
and efficiently to help make sure that the orders were ready to take to the
airport in the afternoon. During the December holidays, the demand of
herbs in Switzerland is a lot higher since it is the winter season there, and
they cannot grow their own herbs.

During my time at Sunny Herbs, I took the initiative to apply the skills I
was taught using Microsoft Excel in Computer Applications Technology at
school. I identified a need for an enhanced, amalgamated salary pay-out
system for staff, making myself instrumental in developing such an
advanced Excel-based product for management.
profile_positions.title: Assistant in farm packhouse

profile_positions.description:
I was tasked to sort computer parts and count stock. I learnt the importance
of being organized and systematic. Time management was a strong
requisite, and I experienced the value of being punctual and disciplined.
profile_positions.title: Stocktaker

profile_positions.description:
Helper
Helper: From the age of 9, I was a runner for stall holders at the Wild Oats
Farmers Market in Sedgefield. Stall holders could not get away from their
stall, so I was tasked to bring them coffee, food or whatever they needed. I
had to: be reliable, be trustworthy, learn to work with people, and, have a
good work ethic.

Stall Assistant for Greek Stall
For six months, I assisted at the Greek stall in the market. I started off
working with the stall owner, together in one stall; when they expanded
over two stalls, I was given my own part to manage. During this time, I
worked with many customers where I had to have effective communication,
listening, and people skills together with a good work ethic.
profile_positions.title: Helper and Stall Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
Kidstop is a project which reaches out to community street children and their families across the George area. At Kistop children receive two nutritious meals, clothes, life skills training, literacy classes, counseling, spiritual input and loving care.

The Community workers visit the streets on a daily basis and monitor the
movements of the children at risk in the community. They identify
children who are leaving their homes and communities and then link them with
the basic reading and writing program, mainstream schools, social worker and
families. The community workers build relationships with the children on the street and invite them to the drop-in center.

I started helping out at Kids because I enjoyed playing with children, sharing love and seeing them happy.
